item.title: 南非寻求数十亿气候基金以维持煤电厂开工
item.description: 南非承诺减少其燃煤发电厂的排放量，以争取获得 26 亿美元的气候融资。尽管南非试图改变 2022 年协议的条款，推迟彻底关闭其中三座设施。【原文：South Africa pledged to slash emissions across its fleet of coal-fired power plants in a bid to secure $2.6 billion in climate finance. That’s despite seeking to alter the terms of a 2022 agreement by delaying the outright closure of three of the facilities.】

item.title: 世界上最脏的燃料之一正在涨价
item.description: 全球石油市场中最肮脏的一角正在上演一场精彩的反弹，原因是为避开中东动乱而航行更长航程的船只需求激增。【原文：One of the dirtiest corners of the global oil market is staging a spectacular rally, boosted by surging demand from ships sailing longer voyages to avoid unrest in the Middle East.】

item.title: 台湾在关闭交易所后为超强台风 "天鸽 "做好准备
item.description: 超强台风 "天鸽 "是今年晚些时候袭击台湾的最大风暴之一，台湾居民正严阵以待，以应对它的直接袭击，因此台湾暂停了 2.5 万亿美元股票市场的交易。【原文：Taiwan has suspended trading on its $2.5 trillion stock market as residents brace for a direct hit from Super Typhoon Kong-Rey, one of the biggest storms to strike the island this late in the year.】

item.title: 亚洲投资级美元债券利差收窄至历史新低
item.description: 在中国政策制定者采取了一系列货币和财政刺激措施，提升了亚洲债务的吸引力之后，亚洲评级最高的债券发行商的美元债券利差收窄至历史最低点。【原文：Dollar bond spreads for Asia’s top-rated issuers have narrowed to a record low after a blitz of monetary and fiscal stimulus measures by Chinese policymakers boosted the appeal of the region’s debt.】

item.title: 亚洲急于建造更环保的办公室，香港却落在后面
item.description:
法规的缺乏和房地产的不景气正在推迟该地区顶级金融中心之一的建筑的绿色升级。【原文：

Lack of regulations and a property slump are delaying green upgrades to buildings in one of the region’s top financial hubs.

】

item.title: 加州州长加文-纽森（Gavin Newsom）抨击高电费
item.description: 加利福尼亚州州长加文-纽森（Gavin Newsom）命令州政府机构想方设法降低已成为全美最高电价的电费，只要任何削减电费的建议不会威胁到应对气候变化的斗争。【原文：California Governor Gavin Newsom ordered state agencies to look for ways to lower electricity rates that have become some of the nation’s highest, so long as any proposed cuts don’t threaten the fight against climate change.】

item.title: 捕鲸许可证争议在冰岛大选前浮出水面
item.description: 就在议会选举前一个月，冰岛唯一一家狩猎公司可能获得的新捕鲸许可证在这个北大西洋国家引发了争议。【原文：A potential new whaling license for Iceland’s only hunting company is stirring controversy in the north Atlantic nation just a month ahead of the parliamentary elections.】

item.title: 国际货币基金组织（IMF）总裁选择参加气候峰会，实际上已超过日程安排
item.description: 国际货币基金组织（IMF）总裁克里斯塔琳娜-格奥尔基耶娃（Kristalina Georgieva）四年来首次没有亲自出席联合国气候峰会，尽管此次峰会的重点是动员全球资金帮助贫困国家适应气候变化。【原文：International Monetary Fund chief Kristalina Georgieva won’t attend the UN climate summit in person for the first time in four years despite its focus on rallying global financing to help poorer countries adapt to climate change.】

item.title: 旅游投资者放弃气候技术，转而投资人工智能
item.description:
随着越来越多的气候初创企业进入资本密集型、以硬件为核心的发展阶段，扩大规模被认为是昂贵而冒险的。这一点也比以往任何时候都更加重要。【原文：

As more climate startups enter a capital-intensive, hardware-focused stage of development, scaling up is seen as expensive and risky. It’s also more important than ever.

】

item.title: 雨水稀少，纽约市即将迎来有史以来最干旱的一个月
item.description:
高压脊阻挡了美国东部的水汽。【原文：

A ridge of high pressure is blocking moisture over the US East.

】

item.title: 如果特朗普获胜，美国气候军团将面临不确定的未来
item.description:
拜登总统受新政启发提出的绿色就业计划一直是共和党批评的目标。【原文：

President Biden’s New Deal-inspired green jobs program has been a target of Republican criticism. 

】

item.title: 灾难误报已成为美国政治格局的一部分
item.description: 今天的时事通讯探讨了海伦飓风过后，错误信息如何像滚雪球一样越滚越大，以及为什么同样的事情也可能在下一次美国灾难中发生。您可以在 Bloomberg.com 上阅读全文。【原文：Today’s newsletter considers how misinformation snowballed in the aftermath of Hurricane Helene, and why the same thing could happen during the next US disaster. You can read the full story online at Bloomberg.com.】

item.title: 全球变暖使澳大利亚极端降雨更加频繁
item.description: 随着气候变化导致极端天气频发，澳大利亚预计将遭受更猛烈的暴雨袭击，有可能迅速淹没城市和淹没农作物。【原文：Australia is expected to get drenched by more intense bursts of heavy rain that threaten to rapidly flood cities and swamp crops, as climate change increases the frequency of extreme weather.】

item.title: 错误信息正将美国灾难变成有毒战场
item.description:
谣言和阴谋论干扰了北卡罗来纳州的灾后重建工作。专家们说，这不是一次性事件。【原文：

Rumors and conspiracy theories interfered with recovery efforts in North Carolina. It wasn’t a one-off, experts say. 

】

item.title: 从波士顿到费城，万圣节期间可能出现接近创纪录的高温天气
item.description:
东北部和大西洋中部地区的气温将达到 70 华氏度以上，甚至可能突破 80 华氏度。【原文：

Temperatures are set to reach the upper 70s and could even crack 80F across the Northeast and Mid-Atlantic.

】

item.title: 铁锈地带正成为电动汽车充电热潮的 "零点 "地带
item.description:
继密歇根州到佛罗里达州的基础设施在第三季度投入使用后，美国今年有望实现每10个加油站配备一个汽车充电器的目标。【原文：

The US is on pace to reach one car charger for every 10 gas stations this year, following a wave of infrastructure coming online from Michigan to Florida in the third quarter.

】

item.title: Aquarian 收购绿色地产贷款机构 PACE Equity 的股份
item.description: 根据彭博社看到的一份声明，投资公司 Aquarian Holdings 收购了 PACE Equity 的大部分股份，该公司向房地产开发商和业主发放商业物业评估清洁能源贷款，即 C-PACE 贷款。【原文：Investment firm Aquarian Holdings has purchased a majority stake in PACE Equity, which hands out commercial property assessed clean energy, or C-PACE loans, to real estate developers and owners, according to a statement seen by Bloomberg.】

item.title: 太阳能产业持续过剩，隆基扩大季度亏损
item.description: 中国太阳能制造商隆基绿能科技股份有限公司连续第四个季度出现亏损，原因是大量供应过剩继续压低价格，损害了该行业的盈利能力。【原文：Chinese solar manufacturer Longi Green Energy Technology Co. recorded its fourth straight quarterly loss as a massive supply glut continues to depress prices and hurt the sector’s profitability.】

item.title: 中国三峡集团计划投资 100 亿美元建设可再生能源-煤电基地
item.description: 中国三峡可再生能源集团有限公司（China Three Gorges Renewables Group Co.【原文：China Three Gorges Renewables Group Co. is planning a massive power base mixing wind, solar, coal and batteries in the Taklamakan Desert, the company said in an exchange filing Wednesday.】

item.title: 强台风 "康芮 "增强为超强台风，预计将登陆台湾
item.description: 预计它将于周四在台湾登陆，登陆地点靠近几周前遭受强风暴袭击的地区。【原文：Kong-Rey has strengthened into a super typhoon as it skirts the Philippines on track for Taiwan, where it’s expected to make landfall Thursday close to an area that was battered by a powerful storm just weeks ago.】

item.title: 印度开始研究控制最有害的温室气体
item.description: 印度政府和电力行业正在探讨逐步减少被认为是最有害的温室气体的可能性，尽管替代品的高昂成本阻碍了相关法规的出台。【原文：India’s government and the power industry are exploring a possible phase down of what’s considered to be the most potent greenhouse gas, although high costs of alternatives stand in the way of a regulation.】

item.title: 夜晚越来越热，气候变化导致睡眠减少
item.description:
《柳叶刀》杂志的一项研究显示，气温升高、干旱和暴雨正日益影响人们的健康。【原文：

Rising temperatures, drought and heavy rainfall are increasingly impacting people’s health, according to a Lancet study.

】

item.title: 日本核电复兴因缺乏工人而受到威胁
item.description: 本周，距离 2011 年日本大地震震中最近的一座核电站重新启动，这被日本政府誉为朝着复兴原子能迈出的重要一步。但这也提醒人们，技术工人的严重短缺可能会延缓核能的复苏。【原文：The restart of the nuclear power plant closest to the epicenter of Japan’s devastating 2011 earthquake this week was hailed by the government as a major step toward reviving atomic energy. It’s also been a reminder of the crippling shortage of skilled workers that could slow that comeback.】

item.title: 绿色宿醉蔓延，瑞典核电复兴面临质疑
item.description: 随着越来越多的公司对旨在清理世界上一些最肮脏行业的大型耗电绿色项目踩下刹车，瑞典的核能复兴面临被削弱的风险。【原文：Sweden’s nuclear revival risks being undermined as more companies pull the brakes on large power-hungry green projects designed to clean up some of the world’s dirtiest industries.】

item.title: 华尔街银行家开展环境、社会和管治债务转换，获得新的交易渠道
item.description: 摩根大通银行（JPMorgan Chase & Co.【原文：An emerging ESG debt market that’s been embraced by bankers at JPMorgan Chase & Co. and Bank of America Corp. is about to see its pipeline get a meaningful boost, thanks to an agreement struck in Colombia.】

item.title: 开发商获得租约以建设新英格兰漂浮风电场
item.description: Avangrid Inc. 和 Invenergy LLC 两家公司在周二的美国政府拍卖会上获得了在缅因湾约 43.9 万英亩土地上安装风力涡轮机的租约。【原文：Avangrid Inc. and Invenergy LLC units secured leases to install wind turbines across some 439,000 acres in the Gulf of Maine during a US government auction Tuesday, a week before a presidential election likely to dictate the shape of their development for years to come.】

item.title: 大型石油公司认为人工智能的蓬勃发展推动了美国天然气的 "疯狂需求
item.description: 被称为 "超大规模企业 "的科技巨头们正在快速发展云计算和人工智能，能源需求的激增正成为化石燃料行业的一大福音。【原文：A surge in energy demand from technology giants that are rapidly developing cloud computing and artificial intelligence — known as hyperscalers — is becoming a major boon for the fossil fuel industry.】

item.title: 南非玉米种植面积将创 2019 年以来最低纪录
item.description: 南非农民几乎不会增加明年用于种植玉米的土地，而且种植季节可能会推迟，这将加剧今年收成下滑四分之一、创五年新低后的玉米短缺问题。【原文：South African farmers will barely increase the land allocated to plant corn for next year’s crop and the season may be late, exacerbating a shortage after the harvest slumped a quarter to a five-year low this year.】

item.title: 古董耐克飞机如何暴露了价值 7 亿美元的碳市场的漏洞
item.description:
从野火到欺诈，一切都在增加碳抵消投资者的风险。现在又有了新的问题，即市场是如何为自己投保的。【原文：

Everything from wildfires to fraud is adding risk for investors in carbon offsets. Now there are new questions about how the market is trying to insure itself.

】

item.title: 台风 "天兔 "将掠过菲律宾，向台湾移动
item.description: 热带气旋 "孔-雷 "已增强为台风，有可能给菲律宾北部带来强风和暴雨，然后向台湾追踪并登陆。【原文：Tropical Cyclone Kong-Rey has intensified into a typhoon and is threatening to bring strong winds and torrential rain to the northern Philippines, before tracking toward Taiwan and making landfall.】
